page.title: 10THE CHANGING COMMUNITY.
page.content: For many hundreds of years the Elloe Marsh community has been a closely knit independent group of people. In the twentieth century, improving transport facilities has enabled a growing number of people to explore the narrow lanes of this bleak and open,yet attractive environment. Many people have felt attracted to this open area, as it offers such a great contrast to the hemmed in hustle and bustle of the city life.The area is also becoming rapidly more popular with London commuters, who can reach the capital easily within two hours using the H.S.T. rail service from Peterborough.
